attributes.action: Rewrite the exclusion policies of what qualifies as an exclusion in UK schools
attributes.additional_details: School exclusions are a direct violation of the right of education by the universal declaration of human rights. Excluding a child/teen from school removes them from education. What this petition aims to do is to help children and or teens who struggle in education and to help them build a sustainable and better future of the next generation.
attributes.background: I would like Parliament to discuss and hopefully rewrite exclusion policies of what qualifies as an exclusion in UK schools in the department of education by this petition.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. 

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

The Department for Education has published guidance on exclusions and suspensions for suspensions: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/school-exclusion

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do for example reviewing the Department for Education’s guidance.
